trans-unit.source: Specifying a DNS Settings in a Virtual Network Configuration File | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Specifying a DNS Settings in a Virtual Network Configuration File | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: How to change DNS server settings in a virtual network using a virtual network configuration file
trans-unit.target: How to change DNS server settings in a virtual network using a virtual network configuration file

trans-unit.source: Specifying DNS settings in a virtual network configuration file
trans-unit.target: Specifying DNS settings in a virtual network configuration file

trans-unit.source: A network configuration file has two elements that you can use to specify Domain Name System (DNS) settings: **DnsServers** and **DnsServerRef**.
trans-unit.target: A network configuration file has two elements that you can use to specify Domain Name System (DNS) settings: **DnsServers** and **DnsServerRef**.

trans-unit.source: You can add a list of DNS servers by specifying their IP addresses and reference names to the **DnsServers** element.
trans-unit.target: You can add a list of DNS servers by specifying their IP addresses and reference names to the **DnsServers** element.

trans-unit.source: You can then use a **DnsServerRef** element to specify which DNS server entries from the DnsServers element are used for different network sites within your virtual network.
trans-unit.target: You can then use a **DnsServerRef** element to specify which DNS server entries from the DnsServers element are used for different network sites within your virtual network.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For information about how to configure the network configuration file, see [Configure a Virtual Network Using a Network Configuration File](virtual-networks-using-network-configuration-file.md).
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] For information about how to configure the network configuration file, see [Configure a Virtual Network Using a Network Configuration File](virtual-networks-using-network-configuration-file.md).

trans-unit.source: For information about each element contained in the network configuration file, see [Azure Virtual Network Configuration Schema](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj157100.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For information about each element contained in the network configuration file, see [Azure Virtual Network Configuration Schema](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/jj157100.aspx).

trans-unit.source: The network configuration file may contain the following elements.
trans-unit.target: The network configuration file may contain the following elements.

trans-unit.source: The title of each element is linked to a page that provides additional information about the element value settings.
trans-unit.target: The title of each element is linked to a page that provides additional information about the element value settings.

trans-unit.source: Dns Element
trans-unit.target: Dns Element

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] The **name** attribute in the **DnsServer** element is used only as a reference for the **DnsServerRef** element.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] The **name** attribute in the **DnsServer** element is used only as a reference for the **DnsServerRef** element.

trans-unit.source: It does not represent the host name for the DNS server.
trans-unit.target: It does not represent the host name for the DNS server.

trans-unit.source: Each **DnsServer** attribute value must be unique across the entire Microsoft Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: Each **DnsServer** attribute value must be unique across the entire Microsoft Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: Virtual Network Sites Element
trans-unit.target: Virtual Network Sites Element

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] In order to specify this setting for the Virtual Network Sites element, it must be previously defined in the DNS element.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] In order to specify this setting for the Virtual Network Sites element, it must be previously defined in the DNS element.

trans-unit.source: The DnsServerRef *name* in the Virtual Network Sites element must refer to a name value specified in the DNS element for DnsServer *name*.
trans-unit.target: The DnsServerRef *name* in the Virtual Network Sites element must refer to a name value specified in the DNS element for DnsServer *name*.

trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.target: Configure a virtual network using Network configuration files
